videoSnippet.title: Ultimate Showdown || Carlsen vs Praggnanandhaa || FTX Crypto Cup (2022)
videoSnippet.description:
Watch entire Bobby Fischer saga here! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0A8-8M8fb04&list=PLDnx7w_xuguENa5LgFG7Gi8aYRVVnXxFE

Have a great day :)

Carlsen, Magnus (2822) - Praggnanandhaa (2751) 
FTX Crypto Cup (chess24.com) [7] 2022.08.21

1.Nf3 d5 2.g3 c5 3.Bg2 Nc6 4.d4 e6 5.O-O cxd4 6.Nxd4 Bc5 7.Nxc6 bxc6 8.c4 Nf6 9.Qc2 Qe7 10.Nc3 O-O 11.Bf4 Ba6 12.Na4 Bb4 13.a3 Bd6 14.Bxd6 Qxd6 15.Rfd1 Qe7 16.b3 Rab8 17.Qc3 dxc4 18.bxc4 c5 19.Rd3 h6 20.Rad1 Rfc8 21.Rd6 Bb7 22.Qe3 Bxg2 23.Kxg2 Qc7 24.Nxc5 Ne8 25.Nxe6 Qb7+ 26.R6d5 fxe6 27.Qxe6+ Kh8 28.Qe4 Qc6 29.R1d4 Qa8 30.Re5 Qxe4+ 31.Rexe4 Rc7 32.Re5 Nf6 33.f3 Rbc8 34.Ra5 Nd7 35.Kf2 Nc5 36.Rd5 a6 37.g4 Rc6 38.h4 Kg8 39.Rf5 R8c7 40.h5 Nb7 41.Rad5 Rxc4 42.Rfe5 R4c5 43.Rxc5 Nxc5 44.f4 Kf7 45.Kf3 Nb7 46.Rd5 Ke6 47.Re5+ Kd6 48.e3 Nc5 49.g5 Ne6 50.gxh6 gxh6 51.Rf5 Ke7 52.Kg4 Rc3 53.Re5 Kf6 54.Rf5+ Kg7 55.Re5 Kf7 56.Rf5+ Ke7 57.Re5 Rc5 58.Re4 Kf6 59.Ra4 a5 60.e4 Nc7 61.Rd4 Ne6 62.Rd7 Nxf4 63.Kxf4 Rxh5 64.Rd6+ Ke7 65.Ra6 Rh4+ 66.Ke5 Rh5+ 67.Kd4 Rb5 68.e5 h5 69.Rh6 Rb3 70.a4 h4 71.Kd5 Rd3+ 72.Ke4 Ra3 73.Kf5 Rf3+ 74.Ke4 Ra3 75.Kf5 Rf3+ 76.Ke4 Ra3

00:00 Hello Everyone!
00:35 Return of Timestamps!!
01:05 Game Starts!
02:18 Completely New Game!
11:33 Pause The Video!!!
15:08 It Was In This Position!
16:00 Contributions!

The 2022 FTX Crypto Cup sees Magnus Carlsen, Alireza Firouzja, Levon Aronian, Anish Giri, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, Liem Le, Hans Niemann and Praggnanandhaa gather in the Eden Roc Miami Beach Hotel in Miami, Florida for the 2nd Major on the $1.6 million Meltwater Champions Chess Tour. $210,000 and a $100,000 Bitcoin bonus is at stake in the 7-round all-play-all tournament. Each match consists of 4 rapid games on the chess24 Playzone, with the winner earning $7,500 (3 points). If the match is tied there's a blitz tiebreak, with 2 blitz games followed, if needed, by a single Armageddon game. The winner earns $5,000 (2 points) and the loser $2,500 (1).

For each rapid game the players have 15 minutes for all their moves, with a 10-second increment after each move. For blitz games it's 5 minutes and a 3-second increment, while for the Armageddon game White has 5 minutes to Black's 4, but a draw counts as a win for Black. No draw offers are allowed before move 40. Official website: chess24.com/tour
